name: NYC Holiday Lights Tour
description: My trip includes a 1 to 1 1/2 hour trip to visit the buildings and areas that display the beautiful lights and decorations for the holiday season.  Starting at Central Park South, where the beautiful lights of the Time Warner Center at Central Park South, where you will also get a view of the Horse drawn carriages, a cup of hot cocoa and we're OFF. You can take pictures as we work our way over to Central Park East and the Apple store.  Barneys is the next stop as we walk over to Bloomingdale's store and their fabulous lights, taking a shortcut to the architectural design of the Bloomberg building.  Across Madison Avenue to Tiffany's and the viewing of the Diamond Snowflake.  Down 5th avenue luxury shopping and over to Park Avenue to view the lights of the Waldorf Astoria, Leona Helmsley building and Grand Central.  Head back to 5th Avenue to Rockefeller Center where you will view Rockefeller Plaza and the Ice Skating Rink, The statue of Atlas and Prometheus, St Patrick's Cathedral, Radio City Music Hall and ending at the famous Magnolia Bakery, where the Ladies from Sex and City made their "Cucpcakes" famous!!!
